data.name: Seablip
data.detailed_description:
Seablip is an open-world pirate RPG and is currently under development by Jardar.

Want to see a preview of how Seablip looks? This is a video showing some old footage of the starter island:
https://youtu.be/z0uZ4zGWbjI



You inherit a small ship from your foster parents and live on the island called Seablip. Meet a big variety of villagers on the island, start new friendships, and help the island back to its former glory! Travel out on the open sea. Upgrade your ship and hire new crewmates to help you in battle and to travel longer on the map.
Dig for treasure, find unique fishes based on island biomes. Participate in the traditional Seablip village events, or investigate why the ice in the north melts and sends dangerous icebergs farther and farther south. Is there an even greater threat that lies beneath the ice?

data.short_description: Build your own house on the heartwarming island called Seablip. Build and upgrade your own ship. Fight as a pirate. Dig for treasure. Fish. Or investigate why the polar ice is melting. A long journey with mystery and adventure awaits!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 7 (SP1+) and Windows 10
  • Processor: 2 Ghz
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 256 mb video memory, shader model 3.0+
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Seablip is under development and the minimum requirements might change before a full release.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Mac OSX 10.10+
  • Processor: 2 Ghz
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 256 mb video memory, OpenGL 2
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Seablip is under development and the minimum requirements might change before a full release.
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
